sen.j: 大住駅（おおすみえき）は、京都府京田辺市大住丸山にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）片町線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Osumi Maruyama, Kyotanabe City, Kyoto Prefecture, Osumi Station is a stop on Katamachi Line which is operated by West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Osumi Station, located in Osumi Maruyama, Kyotanabe City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Katamachi Line, which is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Osumi Station, located in Osumi Maruyama, Kyotanabe City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Katamachi Line, which is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

sen.j: ICOCA・Jスルー利用可能駅。
sen.e: ICOCA and J-Through Card, both passengers' IC cards, are available for payment of railway fares at this station.
sen.cmt: ※ICOCAはIC Operating Card の省略形であり、その中にCard を含む故、訳出の際も Card を付していません。
sen.e: The ICOCA and J-Through cards, both passenger IC cards, are available for payment of railway fares at this station.
The ICOCA and J-Through cards, both passenger IC cards, are available for payment of railway fares at this station.

sen.j: ICOCAの相互利用対象であるSuica、TOICA、PiTaPa（スルッとKANSAI協議会）も利用可能。
sen.e: Suica Card, TOICA and PiTaPa Card, all compatible with ICOCA, are also available (PiTaPa Card is issued by Surutto Kansai Association).
sen.cmt: ※TOICAは Tokai IC Card の省略形であり、上と同様の理由で訳出の際は Card を付していません。
sen.e: The Suica, TOICA and PiTaPa cards, all compatible with ICOCA, are also available (PiTaPa Card is issued by the Surutto Kansai Association).
The Suica, TOICA and PiTaPa cards, all compatible with ICOCA, are also available (PiTaPa Card is issued by the Surutto Kansai Association).

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Structure of the station
The station's structure
Station layout
sen.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: 地上駅。
sen.e: The platforms of the station are level with the ground.
sen.cmt: ここにいう「地上駅（狭義）」とは「プラットホームが地面と同じ高さにある駅」のことであり（Wiki 「地上駅」参照）、それを左では訳出しています。
sen.e: The platforms of the station are level with the ground.
It is an aboveground station.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: かつては、1面1線の4両編成までが停車可能の無人駅であったが、2002年3月23日より2面2線の7両編成までが停車、行き違いの可能な有人駅となっている。
sen.e: Once Osumi Station had been an unmanned stop equipped with one side platform and one boarding area, which could have accommodated a train made up of 4 cars at best, but on March 23, 2002, it was renewed into a manned stop that can accommodate a train made up of 7 cars, and the renewed stop is equipped with two separate platforms and two boarding areas, and these facilities enable two trains to pass each other.
sen.cmt: ①「１面１線」とは「単式プラットホームが１つ、乗り場が１つ」ということであり、「２面２線」とは「相対式プラットホームが２つ、乗り場が２つ」ということです（Wiki 「プラットホーム」参照）。 ②それゆえ「プラットホーム」と「乗り場」を訳し分ける必要が生じるので、前者を"platform"後者を"boarding area"としています。 ③なお、「単式ホーム」は上記Wikiの英訳版を、「相対式ホーム」は「英辞郎 on the web」を参考に、それぞれ"side platform", "separate platform"と訳しています。）
sen.e: Formerly, Osumi Station was an unmanned stop equipped with one side platform and one boarding area, which could only accommodate trains of up to four cars, but on March 23, 2002 it was renewed into a manned stop that could accommodate trains of up to seven cars; the renewed stop is equipped with two separate platforms and two boarding areas, and these facilities enable two trains to pass each other.

Formerly, Osumi Station was an unmanned stop equipped with a one-side platform with one track, which could only accommodate trains of up to four cars, but on March 23, 2002 it was renewed into a manned stop that could accommodate trains of up to seven cars; the renewed stop is equipped with two separate platforms and two tracks, and these facilities enable two trains to pass each other.

sen.j: 駅舎は1番ホーム側にあり、2番ホームとは跨線橋で結ばれている。
sen.e: The station building sits alongside Platform 1, and it is connected with Platform 2 by the flyover.
The station building sits alongside platform 1, and it is connected with platform 2 via the flyover.
The station building sits alongside Platform 1, and it is connected with Platform 2 via a bridge.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルで使われていた表現として、flyover→ bridge としました。Platform と大文字にしました。

sen.j: 自動改札機は簡易タイプとなっている。
sen.e: The automatic ticket gates in the station are ones of a simple version.
sen.cmt: 自動改札機は２台あるので複数形にしています。
sen.e: The automatic ticket gates in the station are simplified versions of the standard type.
The automatic ticket gates in the station are simplified versions of the standard type.

sen.j: 有人駅となったが、駅業務は株式会社ジェイアール西日本交通サービスに委託されており、早朝と夜間は無人となる。
sen.e: The station becomes a manned stop, but JR West Kotsu Service, which is consigned the operation of the station, puts no staff in the station early in the morning and at night.
The station becomes a manned stop, but JR West Kotsu Service, which is consigned the operation of the station, places no staff in the station early in the morning and at night.
The station became a manned stop, but JR West Kotsu Service, which is consigned the operation of the station, places no staff in the station early in the morning and at night.

sen.j: 昼間時の列車交換が隣の松井山手駅や京田辺駅で行われるため、2番ホームの利用は朝方・夕方のみとなっている。
sen.e: During the daytime, "Ressya Koukan," which means that two trains coming from both sides of a single line pass each other on the specially equipped double track, is done at Matsuiyamate Station or Kyotanabe Station, both neighboring stops of Osumi Station, so Platform 2 of Osumi Station is used just in the morning and in the evening.
sen.cmt: 「列車交換」とは「単線の線路の両方向からやってきた二つの車両が、特に設けられた複線の上で行き違いすること」です（Wiki「列車交換」参照）。それを下線部では表現しているつもりです。
sen.e: During the daytime, "Ressya Koukan," which means that two trains coming from both sides of a single line pass each other on the specially equipped double track, is done at Matsuiyamate Station or Kyotanabe Station, both neighboring stops of Osumi Station, so platform 2 of Osumi Station is only used in the morning and evening.

During the daytime, "Ressha Kokan," which means that two trains coming from both sides of a single line pass each other on the specially equipped double track, is done at Matsuiyamate Station or Kyotanabe Station, both neighboring stops of Osumi Station, so Platform 2 of Osumi Station is only used in the morning and evening.
sen.cmt: Platform と大文字にしました。

sen.e: Surroundings of the station
The station's surroundings
Station surroundings
sen.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: バス
sen.e: Bus services
Bus services

sen.j: 京阪バスが運行。
sen.e: Bus services are operated by Keihan Bus Co.,Ltd.
Bus services are operated by Keihan Bus Co., Ltd.
Bus services are operated by Keihan Bus Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 駅前に停留所がある。
sen.e: There is the bus stop in front of Osumi Station.
There is the bus stop in front of Osumi Station.
There is the bus stop in front of Osumi Station.

sen.j: 主に新田辺駅、樟葉駅まで運行している。
sen.e: Most of the bus services go to Kintetsu Shin-Tanabe Station or to Keihan Kuzuha Station.
Most of the bus services go to either Kintetsu Shin-Tanabe Station or Keihan Kuzuha Station.
Most of the bus services go to either Kintetsu Shin-Tanabe Station or Keihan Kuzuha Station.

sen.j: 利用状況
sen.e: Situation of passengers' use
Passenger usage statistics
Passenger use
sen.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約1,682人である。
sen.e: In fiscal 2006, the number of passengers who used this station was about 1682 a day.
Approximately 1,682 passengers used this station each day in fiscal 2006.
Approximately 1,682 passengers used this station each day in fiscal 2006.

sen.j: （京都府統計書より）
sen.e: (according to the statistics of Kyoto Prefcture)

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1952年（昭和27年）12月1日 開業。
sen.e: December 1, 1952--Osumi Station opened.
December 1, 1952: Osumi Station opened.
December 1, 1952: Osumi Station opened.

sen.j: 1面1線の無人駅。
sen.e: It was an unmanned stop that had one side platform and one boarding area.
It was an unmanned stop that had one side platform and one boarding area.
It was an unmanned stop with a one-side platform serving a track.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 国鉄分割民営化により、JR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: April 1, 1987--It became a stop of JR West because of the division and privatization of JNR.
April 1, 1987: It became a stop of JR West due to the division and privatization of JNR.
April 1, 1987: It became a stop of JR West due to the division and privatization of JNR.

sen.j: 2002年（平成14年）3月23日 2面2線の行き違い可能駅、有人駅になる。
sen.e: March 23, 2002--It became a manned stop that has two separate platforms and two boarding areas, which enable two trains to pass each other.
March 23, 2002: It became a manned stop having two separate platforms and two boarding areas, thus enabling two trains to pass each other.
March 23, 2002: It became a manned stop having two separate platforms with two tracks, thus enabling two trains to pass each other.
